code:
defmodule Solution do
  @spec maximum_score(nums :: [integer], k :: integer) :: integer
  def maximum_score(nums, k) do
    nums
    |> Enum.map(&{prime_score(&1), &1})
    |> Enum.sort_by(&{-elem(&1, 0), elem(&1, 1)})
    |> Enum.take(k)
    |> Enum.reduce(1, fn {_, val}, acc -> rem(acc * val, 1_000_000_007) end)
  end

  defp prime_score(1), do: 0
  defp prime_score(n) do
    n
    |> prime_factors
    |> Enum.uniq
    |> length
  end

  defp prime_factors(n), do: prime_factors(n, 2, [])

  defp prime_factors(1, _, acc), do: acc
  defp prime_factors(n, factor, acc) when n >= factor do
    if rem(n, factor) == 0 do
      prime_factors(div(n, factor), factor, [factor | acc])
    else
      prime_factors(n, next_factor(factor), acc)
    end
  end
  defp prime_factors(_n, _factor, acc), do: acc

  defp next_factor(2), do: 3
  defp next_factor(n), do: n + 2

  defp is_prime(1), do: false
  defp is_prime(2), do: true
  defp is_prime(n) do
    2..:math.sqrt(n)
    |> Enum.none?(fn x -> rem(n, x) == 0 end)
  end
end
